author: kidkrypt0
content: hey this may sound like a dumb question but what data is placed in a block when a gas token is minted? is it just the entirety of the contract created in the minting process?

author: Deleted User
content: normally you need to execute transaction to determine that gas tokens were minted. Because call to the `mint` function can happen from other contracts. Currently, minting both GasToken2 and CHI both result in creation of small contracts with some standard bytecode. You can use this bytecode as a "recognition pattern", at least that's what I was planning to do
